snippet: With the economy improving and other changes, Democrats are accepting — in some cases embracing — the inevitable yoking of their campaigns to President Obama’s.
abstract: Congressional Democrats are accepting--and in some cases embracing--the inevitable yoking of their campaigns to President Obama’s, citing the improved economy and a divisive push by Republicans on social issues; many have begun going out of their way to publicly back Obama's proposals, finding that he has increasing resonance with middle class voters in their home districts.
lead_paragraph: With the economy improving and other changes, Democrats are accepting — in some cases embracing — the inevitable yoking of their campaigns to President Obama’s.

headline.main: Democrats Are Warming to Obama Connection
headline.print_headline: Democrats Are Warming To Obama Connection
